policyDisplayName: ACM certificate should not expire in mentioned days from current date
policyDesc:
Check expiry date of  ACM certificate on following conditions:-

1. If expiry date is under 90 days from current date then it is non-compliance otherwise compliance.
resolution: Rotate the keys before the expiry

policyDisplayName: Deny public access to RDS database
policyDesc: Terminate all unencrypted or publicly available RDS upon creation
resolution: Ensure to terminate any publicly accessible rds instances or update the instance with storage encryption enabled.

policyDisplayName: Remove Expired ACM Certificates
policyDesc: Ensure expired SSL/TLS certificates are removed from AWS Certificate Manager (ACM).
resolution: Remove all the expired Secure Sockets Layer/Transport Layer Security (SSL/TLS) certificates managed by AWS Certificate Manager.

policyDisplayName: Enable CloudTrail Global Services
policyDesc: Ensure that CloudTrail trails record API calls for global services such as IAM, STS, and CloudFront.
resolution: Ensure that your Amazon CloudTrail trails are recording both regional and global events in order to increase the visibility of the API activity in your AWS cloud account for security and management purposes

policyDisplayName: Enable EMR data encryption
policyDesc: NULL
resolution: NULL

policyDisplayName: Encrypt ElastiCache for Redis data
policyDesc: Ensure in-transit and at-rest encryption is enabled for Amazon ElastiCache Redis clusters.
resolution: To enable in-transit and at-rest encryption for your existing AWS ElastiCache Redis clusters, you must re-create them with the necessary encryption configuration

policyDisplayName: Encrypt OpenSearch data at rest
policyDesc: Ensure at-rest encryption is enabled for your Amazon ElasticSearch domains
resolution: To enable at-rest encryption for your existing AWS ElasticSearch domains, you must re-create them with the necessary encryption configuration

policyDisplayName: Use KMS CMK to encrypt OpenSearch
policyDesc: Ensure AWS ElasticSearch domains are encrypted with KMS Customer Master Keys.
resolution: To encrypt an existing AWS ElasticSearch domain with your own KMS Customer Master Key, you must re-create the domain with the necessary encryption configuration. To create the necessary KMS CMK and set up the new ES domain, enable custom encryption and copy your existing data to it.

policyDisplayName: Encrypt OpenSearch data in transit
policyDesc: Ensure node-to-node encryption is enabled for your Amazon ElasticSearch (ES) clusters.
resolution: To enable node-to-node encryption for your existing Amazon ElasticSearch domains, you need to re-create them with the necessary configuration.

policyName: IAM customer managed policies should not have full administrative privileges
policyDisplayName: Deny customer managed policy with full administrative privileges
policyDesc: IAM customer managed policies that allow full "*:*" administrative privileges should not be created.
resolution: Remove or update the policy to revoke the administrative privileges.

policyName: IAM roles should not have customer managed policies with full administrative privileges
policyDisplayName: Detach customer managed policy with full access from IAM role
policyDesc: IAM roles with customer managed policies or inline policies that allow full "*:*" administrative privileges should not be attached to the role
resolution: Detach the customer managed or inline policy to revoke the administrative privileges.

policyName: IAM users should not have customer managed policy with full administrative privileges
policyDisplayName: Detach customer managed policy with full access from IAM user
policyDesc: Customer managed policies or inline policies that allow full "*:*" administrative privileges should not be attached to the user
resolution: Detach the customer managed or inline policy to revoke the administrative privileges

policyName: Support role should be created for the AWS support incidents
policyDisplayName: Configure dedicated IAM role for AWS support access
policyDesc: Create a dedicated support role to manage incidents with AWS Support
resolution: If there is no role created, then create a separate support role and attach the policy to the role. Users or group should use this role for support access.

policyName: AWS Security hub should be enabled
policyDisplayName: Enable AWS Security hub
policyDesc: Security Hub collects security data from across AWS accounts, services, and supported third-party partner products and helps you analyze your security trends and identify the highest priority security issues.
resolution: Grant the permissions required to enable Security Hub, attach the Security Hub managed policy AWSSecurityHubFullAccess to an IAM user, group, or role.

policyName: EKS Kubernetes secrets should be encrypted
policyDisplayName: Enable encryption for EKS Kubernetes Secrets using envelope encryption
policyDesc: Enable encryption for EKS Kubernetes Secrets using envelope encryption in order to meet security and compliance requirements
resolution: Enable envelope encryption of Kubernetes secrets using KMS Customer Master Keys

policyName: Control plane logs should be enabled for EKS
policyDisplayName: Enable control plane logs for EKS
policyDesc: Enable control plane logs for EKS to send audit and diagnostic logs directly to AWS CloudWatch Logs
resolution: Enable EKS control plane logging for Amazon EKS

policyName: Public access should be disabled for EKS Cluster endpoint
policyDisplayName: Disable public access to EKS Cluster endpoint
policyDesc: Disable public access to EKS cluster endpoint to avoid exposing private data and reducing security risks
resolution: Disable public accessibility of EKS cluster endpoint

policyName: EKS cluster version should be updated to the latest version
policyDisplayName: Update EKS cluster version to the latest
policyDesc: EKS cluster version should be updated to the latest version in order to introduce new software features, bug fixes, security patches and performance improvements.
resolution: Update the Kubernetes version for your existing Amazon EKS clusters

policyName: Hardware MFA should be enabled for root account
policyDisplayName: Enable hardware MFA for root account
policyDesc: Enable hardware MFA(Multi-Factor Authentication) for root account to secure access to AWS resources
resolution: Install and configure a hardware MFA device for the root account.

policyName: Permissions should be assigned through groups
policyDisplayName: Only use IAM groups to assign User Permissions
policyDesc: To ensure the principle of least privilege, provide permissions to IAM users only though IAM group
resolution: Create an IAM group and attach policies and add user.Detach the policy from user

policyName: AWS Config configuration changes should have log metric filter and alarm
policyDisplayName: Configure log metric filter and alarm AWS Config configuration changes
policyDesc: Monitoring changes to AWS Config configuration will help ensure sustained visibility of configuration items within the AWS account.
resolution: Create CloudWatch Logs Metric Filter and corresponding alarm for AWS Config configuration changes

policyName: AWS Organizations changes should have log metric filter and alarm
policyDisplayName: Configure log metric filter and alarm for AWS Organizations changes
policyDesc: Monitoring AWS Organizations changes can help you prevent any unwanted, accidental or intentional modifications that may lead to unauthorized access or other security breaches.
resolution: Create CloudWatch Logs Metric Filter and corresponding alarm for AWS Organizations changes

policyName: Log metric filter and alarm should be enabled for CloudTrail configuration changes
policyDisplayName: Configure log metric filter and alarm for CloudTrail configuration changes
policyDesc: Monitoring changes to CloudTrails configuration will help ensure sustained visibility to activities performed in the AWS account
resolution: Create CloudWatch Logs Metric Filter and corresponding alarm for CloudTrail configuration changes

policyName: Disabling or scheduled deletion of customer created CMKs should have log metric filter and alarm
policyDisplayName: Configure log metric filter and alarm for disabling or scheduled deletion of customer created CMKs
policyDesc: Create Amazon CloudWatch alarms for AWS KMS Customer Master Keys so that it will help you prevent any accidental or intentional modifications that may lead to unprotected data access or other security breaches.
resolution: Create CloudWatch Logs Metric Filter and corresponding alarm for disabling or scheduled deletion of customer created CMKs

policyName: IAM policy changes should have log metric filter and alarm
policyDisplayName: Configure log metric filter and alarm for IAM policy changes
policyDesc: Monitoring changes to IAM policies will help ensure authentication and authorization controls remain intact.
resolution: Create CloudWatch Logs Metric Filter and corresponding alarm for IAM policy changes

policyName: AWS Management Console authentication failures should have log metric filter and alarm
policyDisplayName: Configure log metric filter and alarm for AWS Management Console authentication failures
policyDesc: Monitoring failed console logins may decrease lead time to detect an attempt to brute force a credential, which may provide an indicator, such as source IP, that can be used in other event correlation.
resolution: Create CloudWatch Logs Metric Filter and corresponding alarm for AWS Management Console authentication failures

policyName: Management Console sign-in without MFA should have log metric filter and alarm
policyDisplayName: Configure log metric filter and alarm for Management Console sign-in without MFA
policyDesc: Monitoring for single-factor console logins will increase visibility into accounts that are not protected by MFA.
resolution: Create CloudWatch Logs Metric Filter and corresponding alarm for Management Console sign-in without MFA

policyName: Changes to NACL should have log metric filter and alarm
policyDisplayName: Configure log metric filter and alarm for changes to NACL
policyDesc: Monitoring changes to NACLs will help ensure that AWS resources and services are not unintentionally exposed.
resolution: Create CloudWatch Logs Metric Filter and corresponding alarm for changes to NACL

policyName: Changes to network gateways  should have log metric filter and alarm
policyDisplayName: Configure log metric filter and alarm for changes to network gateways
policyDesc: Monitoring changes to network gateways will help ensure that all ingress egress traffic traverses the VPC border via a controlled path.
resolution: Create CloudWatch Logs Metric Filter and corresponding alarm for changes to network gateways

policyName: Usage of root account should have log metric filter and alarm
policyDisplayName: Configure log metric filter and alarm for usage of root account
policyDesc: Monitoring for root account logins will provide visibility into the use of a fully privileged account and an opportunity to reduce the use of it.
resolution: Create CloudWatch Logs Metric Filter and corresponding alarm for usage of root account

policyName: Route table changes should have log metric filter and alarm
policyDisplayName: Configure log metric filter and alarm for route table changes
policyDesc: Monitoring changes to route tables will help ensure that all VPC traffic flows through an expected path.
resolution: Create CloudWatch Logs Metric Filter and corresponding alarm for route table changes

policyName: S3 bucket policy changes should have log metric filter and alarm
policyDisplayName: Configure log metric filter and alarm for S3 bucket policy changes
policyDesc: Monitoring changes to S3 bucket policies may reduce time to detect and correct permissive policies on sensitive S3 buckets.
resolution: Create CloudWatch Logs Metric Filter and corresponding alarm for S3 bucket policy changes

policyName: Security group changes should have log metric filter and alarm
policyDisplayName: Configure log metric filter and alarm for security group changes
policyDesc: Monitoring changes to security group will help ensure that resources and services are not unintentionally exposed.
resolution: Create CloudWatch Logs Metric Filter and corresponding alarm for AWS security group changes

policyName: Unauthorized API calls should have log metric filter and alarm
policyDisplayName: Configure log metric filter and alarm for unauthorized API calls
policyDesc: Monitoring unauthorized API calls will help reveal application errors and may reduce time to detect malicious activity
resolution: Create CloudWatch Logs Metric Filter and corresponding alarm for unauthorized API calls

policyName: VPC changes should have log metric filter and alarm
policyDisplayName: Configure log metric filter and alarm for VPC changes
policyDesc: Monitoring changes to VPC will help ensure VPC traffic flow is not getting impacted.
resolution: Create CloudWatch Logs Metric Filter and corresponding alarm for VPC changes

policyDisplayName: Amazon RDS DB instances should not be idle
policyDesc: Checks the configuration of your Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) for any DB instances that appear to be idle. If a DB instance has not had a connection for a prolonged period of time, you can delete the instance to reduce costs. If persistent storage is needed for data on the instance, you can use lower-cost options such as taking and retaining a DB snapshot. Manually created DB snapshots are retained until you delete them.
resolution: Consider taking a snapshot of the idle DB instance and then deleting it,See Deleting a DB Instance with a Final Snapshot

policyDisplayName: Encrypt EBS Volume
policyDesc: Ensure that existing Elastic Block Store (EBS) attached volumes are encrypted to meet security and compliance requirements.
resolution: To enable encryption on your existing EBS volumes, you need to re-create them and turn the encryption feature on

policyDisplayName: Invalid Security Group reference in Launch Config
policyDesc: Ensure AWS Launch Configurations are utilizing active Security Groups.
resolution: Copy the existing launch configuration and update the security group details with the required changes and attach the configuration with the auto scaling group.

policyDisplayName: Invalid AMI reference in Launch Config
policyDesc: Ensure AWS Launch Configurations are utilizing active Amazon Machine Images.
resolution: Copy the existing launch configuration and update the AMI details with the required changes and attach the configuration with the auto scaling group.

policyDisplayName: Enable CLB Secure Listener
policyDesc: Ensure that your AWS ELBs listeners are using a secure protocol (HTTPS or SSL or TLS).
resolution: To secure the connection between your application clients and your load balancers, update AWS ELB listeners configuration to support the secured protocols. For classic ELB update the configuration with HTTPS/SSL protocol.For ELBV2 use HTTPS/TLS

policyDisplayName: Enable ELB HTTPS Listener
policyDesc: Ensure that your AWS ELBs listeners are using a secure protocol (HTTPS or SSL or TLS).
resolution: To secure the connection between your application clients and your load balancers, update AWS ELB listeners configuration to support the secured protocols. For classic ELB update the configuration with HTTPS/SSL protocol.For ELBV2 use HTTPS/TLS

policyDisplayName: ELBv2 ALB Security Group
policyDesc: Ensure that your Amazon ELBv2 load balancers have secure and valid security groups.
resolution: Create a new security group and add rule to add the required inbound rule(s) that will match your load balancer listeners configuration and attach this security group to the load balancer

policyDisplayName: ELB Security Group
policyDesc: Ensure that your Amazon ELBv2 load balancers have secure and valid security groups.
resolution: Create a new security group and add rule to add the required inbound rule(s) that will match your load balancer listeners configuration and attach this security group to the load balancer

policyDisplayName: Deny public access in Default Security Group
policyDesc: Ensure default security groups restrict all public traffic to follow AWS security best practices.
resolution: Configuring default security group to restrict all traffic will encourage least privilege security group development. Do not set Inbound Source to 0.0.0.0/0 (IPv4) or ::/0 (IPv6).

policyDisplayName: VPC Peering Connections To Accounts Outside AWS Organization
policyDesc: VPC Peering Connections Should Not Be Available To Accounts Outside AWS Organization
resolution: Ensure external VPC peering connections not exist

policyDisplayName: Enable AWS AMI Encryption
policyDesc: Ensure that your existing AMIs are encrypted to meet security and compliance requirements.
resolution: To encrypt an existing AMI, copy the AMI and enable the encryption and choose the Customer Master Key for the encryption. Then the instances can be created from the new copied AMI.

policyDisplayName: Use CMK to Encrypt EBS Volume
policyDesc: Ensure EBS volumes are encrypted with KMS CMKs in order to have full control over data encryption and decryption.
resolution: Create a new CMK KMS key and use this key for creating snapshot. Use the newly created snapshot for creating volume and attach this volume to your instance.

policyDisplayName: Encrypt DocumentDB
policyDesc: Ensure that Amazon DocumentDB clusters data is encrypted at rest.
resolution: Create a snapshot of the unencrypted cluster.Restore the snapshot and enable encryption  with appropriate AWS KMS key. Then add instances to the new DocumentDB cluster. Delete the unencrypted clusters.

policyDisplayName: Use CMK to encrypt DocumentDB
policyDesc: Ensure that Amazon DocumentDB clusters are encrypted with KMS Customer Master Keys (CMKs).
resolution: Create KMS Customer Master Key.Create a snapshot of the unencrypted cluster.Restore the snapshot and enable encryption  with the new CMK. Then add instances to the new cluster.

policyDisplayName: Use CMK to Encrypt DynamoDB Tables
policyDesc: Ensure that Amazon DynamoDB data is encrypted using AWS-managed Customer Master Keys.
resolution: To make sure the DynamoDB is server side encrypted with KMS, update or create the DynamoDB with the encryption as AWS managed.

policyDisplayName: Encrypt EFS
policyDesc: Ensure encryption is enabled for AWS EFS file systems to protect your data at rest.
resolution: To encrypt an existing AWS EFS file system you must copy the data from the existing file system onto the new one, that has the encryption feature enabled.

policyDisplayName: Enable Envelope Encryption for EKS Kubernetes Secrets
policyDesc: Ensure that envelope encryption of Kubernetes secrets using Amazon KMS is enabled.
resolution: To enable envelope encryption of Kubernetes secrets for existing Amazon EKS clusters, re-create the clusters using KMS Customer Master Keys (CMKs).

policyDisplayName: Encrypt Appflow with Customer Managed Key
policyDesc: Ensure that Amazon AppFlow flows are encrypted with KMS Customer Master Keys (CMKs).
resolution: To enable encryption for AppFlow flows using Customer Master Key, re-create the flow with the configuration of the flow for which the encryption should be enabled, and enable the encryption and choose the Customer Master Key already created for the encryption key.

policyDisplayName: Encrypt Athena Query Results
policyDesc: Ensure that AWS Athena query results stored in Amazon S3 are encrypted at rest.
resolution: To enable encryption, enable the encrypt query results in settings and choose the Customer Master Key created.

policyDisplayName: Encrypt Comprehend Analysis Results
policyDesc: Ensure that AWS Comprehend analysis job results stored in Amazon S3 are encrypted at rest.
resolution: To enable encryption, create a customer managed key. Copy the job that should be re-configured and use the new Customer Managed Key for the new job.

policyDisplayName: Encrypt DynamoDB Accelerator(DAX) Cluster
policyDesc: Ensure Amazon DynamoDB Accelerator (DAX) clusters enforce Server-Side Encryption (SSE).
resolution: To enable encryption for an existing DAX cluster, re-create the cluster with the encryption enabled.

policyDisplayName: Use CMK to Encrypt DMS Replication
policyDesc: Ensure that Amazon DMS replication instances are encrypted with KMS Customer Master Keys (CMKs).
resolution: To encrypt an existing Amazon DMS replication instance with your own AWS KMS Customer Master Key (CMK) you have to re-create the instance with the new Customer Master Key.

policyDisplayName: Deny public access to DMS
policyDesc: Ensure that AWS DMS replication instances are not publicly accessible and prone to security risks.
resolution: To disable public accessibility for your Amazon DMS replication instances, you must re-create these instances with the necessary configuration in order to be reachable only within your VPC network

policyDisplayName: Configure Task Log Driver
policyDesc: Ensure that a log driver has been defined for each active Amazon ECS task definition.
resolution: To configure log driver for the task definitions, create a new revision for the task definition that should be reconfigured. Update the new revision with the log driver and the cloud watch log group which is created already.

policyDisplayName: Use Customer Managed Key to encrypt EFS
policyDesc: Ensure EFS file systems are encrypted with KMS Customer Master Keys (CMKs) in order to have full control over data encryption and decryption.
resolution: To encrypt an existing AWS EFS file system with your own AWS KMS CMK customer-managed key you must copy the data from the existing file system onto the new one, that has the encryption feature enabled.

policyDisplayName: Resolve IAM Access Analyzer Findings
policyDesc: Ensure that IAM Access Analyzer findings are reviewed and resolved to maintain access security to your AWS resources.
resolution: To resolve findings generated from access that you did not intend to allow, modify the policy statement to remove the permissions that allow access to the identified resource

policyDisplayName: Cloudtrail should be enabled in multi region
policyDesc:
Check if centralized cloudtrail is enabled for accounts.

Following conditions to be checked:-

1. Check if "mentioned cloud trial" is attached to  cloudtrail or not.
2. If it is attached then it will be compliance.
resolution: Enable the cloudtrail in multi region

policyDisplayName: AWS Guard Duty service should be enabled on all regions of all AWS accounts
policyDesc: All the AWS accounts should have guard duty enabled. Amazon GuardDuty is a managed threat detection service that continuously monitors for malicious or unauthorized behavior to help you protect your AWS accounts and workloads. It monitors for activity such as unusual API calls or potentially unauthorized deployments that indicate a possible account compromise. GuardDuty also detects potentially compromised instances or reconnaissance by attackers

policyDisplayName: IAM users should not be inactive for more than 90 days
policyDesc: IAM users who have not logged into AWS and have no API activity for 90 days will be considered inactive IAM users and their accounts will be terminated.
resolution: Reach out to paladincloud.io for exceptions

policyDisplayName: MFA should be enabled for Root User
policyDesc: Check MFA enabled for root user(account)
resolution: Enable the MFA for root user

policyDisplayName: Access log should be enabled to cloudfront and attached to mentioned bucket
policyDesc: Check access log enabled in S3 bucket for CloudFront with 'logging' tag name as 'true' or without logging tags should be passed.
resolution: Access log should be enabled to cloudfront and attached to mentioned bucket

policyName: Validation should be enabled for CloudTrail log file
policyDisplayName: Enable Validation for CloudTrail log file
policyDesc: Enabling validation for CloudTrail log file can be used to determine whether a log file was changed, deleted, or unchanged after CloudTrail delivered the log
resolution: Enable Log file validation on each trails

policyName: CloudTrail logs should be configured to leverage SSE and KMS CMKs
policyDisplayName: Encrypt CloudTrail to use KMS CMKs
policyDesc: Configuring CloudTrail to use SSE-KMS provides additional confidentiality controls on log data
resolution: configure CloudTrail to use SSE KMS

policyDisplayName: All Cloud watch events from all accounts should be sent to DEDICATED ACCOUNTID default event bus
policyDesc: Events from all AWS account should be routed to a central event bus so that the events and be processed and analyzed centrally.
resolution: Events from all AWS account should be routed to a central event.

policyDisplayName: Non-Allow listed  IAM Role should not have EC2 RunInstance privilege
policyDesc: IAM roles donot have the permission to launch instances ist of privileges its checking right now ec2:*,*,ec2:RunInstances
resolution: Attach deny policy / remove elevated permissions,If you want exception you may please request exception for this rule through PacBot.

policyDisplayName: EC2 instances should not be publicly accessible on SSH port 22
policyDesc: SSH port 22 should not be accessible from internet. Port 22 should be open only to the internal 10.*.*.* network. Further reducing the permitted IP addresses or ranges allowed to communicate to destination hosts on TCP port 22 is recommended. An exposed SSH port 22 pose a great security risk. Dedicated bastion hosts can have port open to internet with appropriate SSH config.
resolution: Remove the rule from the security groups that allows inbound access from 0.0.0.0/0.

policyDisplayName: EC2 instances should not have any publicly accessible ports
policyDesc: EC2 instances should not be directly accessible from internet (Except for the servers in DMZ zone). Ideally these instances should be behind firewall (AWS WAF or any other firewall)
resolution: Do not allow global access to well known ports of an EC2 instance directly (except for 80 and 443)

policyDisplayName: Access log should be enabled to App ELB and attached to mentioned bucket
policyDesc: Check access log enabled in S3 bucket for ELB with 'logging' tag name as 'true' or without logging tags should be passed.
resolution: Access log should be enabled to ELB and attached to mentioned bucket

policyDisplayName: Access log should be enabled to Classic ELB and attached to mentioned bucket
policyDesc: Check access log enabled in S3 bucket for ELB with 'logging' tag name as 'true' or without logging tags should be passed.
resolution: Access log should be enabled to ELB and attached to mentioned bucket

policyDisplayName: EBS snapshots should not be publicly accessible
policyDesc: Depending on the purpose for which the EBS was used, the snapshot might carry sensistive information about our cloud ecosystem or might carry customer PII or CPNI or it could be anything. The cases where we need to make a snpashot public is very rare, those cases have to go through an exception process
resolution: Make the snapshot private

policyDisplayName: Every EC2 instance should be scanned by Qualys vulnerability assessment tool atleast once a month
policyDesc: All assets in Cloud should be scanned by Qualys vulnerability assessment tool atleast once a month. It would be ideal to have the Qulays Cloud Agent installed on all the assets. This would eliminate the need to have manual external scans
resolution: Install Qualys Cloud Agent on the server or get the asset scanned manually by VMAS team every month

policyDisplayName: An Ec2 instance with remotely exploitable vulnerability (S5) should not be open to internet
policyDesc: An Ec2 instance with remotely exploitable vulnerability (S5) should not be open to internet, this instance can be easily compromised from a remote location
resolution: Immediately remove the internet access,Apply the vulnerability fix

policyDisplayName: EC2 instances should not be in stopped state for more than 60 days
policyDesc: Stopped EC2 instances still incur cost for the volumes,elastic IP associated with it, potential AWS marketplace license costs as well.
resolution: Terminate the EC2 instance if it is no longer required.

policyDisplayName: EC2 instances should not be publicly accessible on default SQL Browser port 1434
policyDesc: Global permission to access the well known services like TCP on port 1434 (SQL Browser) should not be allowed.
resolution: Do not allow global access to well known ports of an EC2 instance directly (except for 80 and 443)

policyDisplayName: EC2 instances should not be publicly accessible on default MySQL port 3306
policyDesc: Global permission to access the well known services like TCP on port 3306 (MySQL) should not be allowed.
resolution: Do not allow global access to well known ports of an EC2 instance directly (except for 80 and 443)

policyDisplayName: EC2 instances should not be publicly accessible on port 138
policyDesc: Global permission to access the well known services like TCP on port 138 should not be allowed.
resolution: Do not allow global access to well known ports of an EC2 instance directly (except for 80 and 443)

policyDisplayName: EC2 instances should not be publicly accessible on port 80
policyDesc: Global permission to access the well known services like HTTP on port 80 should not be allowed.
resolution: Do not allow global access to well known ports of an EC2 instance directly (except for 80 and 443)

policyDisplayName: EC2 instances should not be publicly accessible on port 8080
policyDesc: This rule creates an issue, if the port 8080 is open to internet.
resolution: NULL

policyDisplayName: EC2 instances should not be publicly accessible on default POSTGRESQL port 5432
policyDesc: Global permission to access the well known services like TCP on port 5432 (POSTGRESQL) should not be allowed.
resolution: Do not allow global access to well known ports of an EC2 instance directly (except for 80 and 443)

policyDisplayName: EC2 instances should not be publicly accessible on port 3389
policyDesc: RDP port 3389 should not be accessible from internet. Port 3389 should be open only to the internal 10.*.*.* network. Further reducing the permitted IP addresses or ranges allowed to communicate to destination hosts on RDP port 3389 is recommended. An exposed RDP port 3389 pose a great security risk.
resolution: Remove the rule from the security groups that allows inbound access from 0.0.0.0/0.

policyDisplayName: Any Ec2 instance should not have S3 vulnerability
policyDesc: If an EC2 Instance having S5, S4 and S3 vulnerability report it as an issue with severity high, medium and low respectively

policyDisplayName: Any Ec2 instance should not have S4 vulnerability
policyDesc: If an EC2 Instance having S5, S4 and S3 vulnerability report it as an issue with severity high, medium and low respectively

policyDisplayName: Any Ec2 instance should not have S5 vulnerability
policyDesc: If an EC2 Instance having S5, S4 and S3 vulnerability report it as an issue with severity high, medium and low respectively

policyDisplayName: Elastic Search endpoint should not be open to internet
policyDesc: Make necessary changes to the access control policy and security groups to make the ES endpoint private, Allow only a specific list of IP addresses, Once the Elastic Search endpoint is not publicly accessible PacBot will auotmatically close the issue, In case you want this to be public then send a request for exeception to Paladincloud.io, You can also request exception from the policy violation details page, Secops will review and involve DSO if required and grant exception and PacBot will automatically ignore this resource till the expiry of exception.
resolution: Make necessary changes to the access control policy and security groups to make the ES endpoint private, Allow only a specific list of IP addresses, Once the Elastic Search endpoint is not publicly accessible PacBot will auotmatically close the issue, In case you want this to be public then send a request for exeception to paladincloud.io, You can also request exception from the policy violation details page, Secops will review and involve DSO if required and grant exception and PacBot will automatically ignore this resource till the expiry of exception.

policyDisplayName: Application ELB should not be exposed to internet
policyDesc: All internet facing ELB will be marked as a policy violation.You would need to request for an exception by providing Cloud Application Name What component of the application is made public?Why it has to be public?What data will be exposed via the internet facing system?The reason why all internet-facing are marked as violation is, the number of cases where we need to have internet-facing load balancers is small and these legitimate cases will be reviewed and granted exception. Developer often associate internet-facing load balancers for internal applications and end up exposing sensitive data.
resolution: NULL

policyDisplayName: ClassicELB should not be exposed to internet
policyDesc: All internet facing ELB will be marked as a policy violation.You would need to request for an exception by providing Cloud Application Name What component of the application is made public?Why it has to be public?What data will be exposed via the internet facing system?The reason why all internet-facing are marked as violation is, the number of cases where we need to have internet-facing load balancers is small and these legitimate cases will be reviewed and granted exception. Developer often associate internet-facing load balancers for internal applications and end up exposing sensitive data.
resolution: NULL

policyName: Expired IAM certificates should be removed
policyDisplayName: Remove expired IAM certificates
policyDesc: Ensure that all the expired SSL/TLS certificates stored in AWS IAM are removed
resolution: Remove the expired IAM certificate.

policyDisplayName: EC2 instance should not have guard duty findings
policyDesc: Amazon GuardDuty is a managed threat detection service that continuously monitors your VPC flow logs, CloudTrail event logs and DNS logs for malicious or unauthorized behavior. When GuardDuty detects a suspicious or unexpected behavior in your AWS account, it generates a finding. A finding is a notification that contains information about a potential security threat identified by the GuardDuty service. The finding details includes data about the finding actor, the AWS resource(s) involved in the suspicious activity, the time when the activity occurred and so on.
resolution: Follow the step by step guide line provided for each finding from the Guard Duty console,Please reach out to paladincloud.io in case of any queries about how to fix a finding

policyDisplayName: IAM certificate should not expire in mentioned days from current date
policyDesc:
Check IAM certificate expiry date on following conditions:-

1. If expiry date is under 90 days from current date then it is non-compliance otherwise compliance.
resolution: Rotate the keys before the expiry

policyDisplayName: IAM accesskey must be rotated every 90 days
policyDesc: Access keys of IAM accounts should be rotated every 90 days in order to decrease the likelihood of accidental exposures and protect  AWS resources against unauthorized access
resolution: Rotate the access keys every 90 days

policyDisplayName: All AWS accounts should follow the IAM password policy
policyDesc: Enforce a strong password policy on IAM console authentications. By default AWS does not configure the maximal strength password complexity policy on your behalf.
resolution: Log into your AWS console,Go to the IAM service,On the left menu select Password Policy which should be the bottom option,Set the Minimum Password Length form field to 12 (or higher) and Select each of the checkboxes so that all four required  complexity options are selected,Depending on your corporate policy you may wish to allow users to change their own passwords,We recommend that you permit users to do so,Apply your new password policy and you have satisfied this security remediation

policyName: AWS IAM user should have single access key
policyDisplayName: Use single access key for IAM user
policyDesc: Ensure there is only one active access key available for any single IAM user
resolution: Update to make the key inactive or delete the access keys which are no longer used.

policyDisplayName: Lambda functions should not have administrative permissions
policyDesc: Lambda functions should not have administrative permissions (Managed Policy : AdministratorAccess). Least privileges should be granted to lambda functions. Also IAM privileges should never be granted to lambda functions. (Exceptional cases has to be reviewed and prior allow-listing would be required.)
resolution: Remove AdministratorAccess policy associated with lambda functions,Remove IAM privileges associated with the lambda function
